==Events==
* [[330]] &ndash; [[Byzantium]] is renamed [[New Rome|''Nova Roma'']] during a dedication ceremony, but it is more popularly referred to as [[Constantinople]].
* [[868]] &ndash; A copy of the [[Diamond Sutra]] is printed in China, making it the oldest known dated printed book.
* [[912]] &ndash; [[Alexander (Byzantine emperor)|Alexander]] becomes Emperor of the [[Byzantine Empire]].
*[[1310]] &ndash; In France, fifty-four members of the [[Knights Templar]] are [[Burning at the stake|burned at the stake]] as [[heresy|heretics]].
*[[1647]] &ndash; [[Peter Stuyvesant]] arrives in [[New Amsterdam]] to replace [[Willem Kieft]] as [[Director-General of New Netherland|Director-General]] of [[New Netherland]], the [[Dutch colonization of the Americas|Dutch colonial settlement]] in present-day New York City.
*[[1672]] &ndash; [[Franco-Dutch War]]: [[Louis XIV of France]] invades the [[Netherlands]].
*[[1745]] &ndash; [[War of the Austrian Succession]]: [[Battle of Fontenoy (1745)|Battle of Fontenoy]] &ndash; French forces defeat an [[England|Anglo]]-[[Netherlands|Dutch]]-[[Hanover]]ian army.
*[[1792]] &ndash; [[Captain (nautical)|Captain]] [[Robert Gray (sea-captain)|Robert Gray]] becomes the first documented [[white people|white person]] to sail into the [[Columbia River]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]] [[Spencer Perceval]] is assassinated by [[John Bellingham]] in the lobby of the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]], London.
*[[1813]] &ndash; In Australia, [[William Lawson (explorer)|William Lawson]], [[Gregory Blaxland]] and [[William Wentworth]] lead an [[1813 crossing of the Blue Mountains|expedition to cross the Blue Mountains]] west of Sydney. Their route opens up inland Australia for continued expansion throughout the 19th century.
*[[1820]] &ndash; {{HMS|Beagle}}, the ship that will take [[Charles Darwin]] on his scientific voyage, is launched.
*[[1846]] &ndash; President [[James K. Polk]] asked for and received a Declaration of War against Mexico, starting the [[Mexican–American War]]
*[[1857]] &ndash; [[Indian Rebellion of 1857]]: Indian rebels seize [[Delhi]] from the British.
*[[1858]] &ndash; [[Minnesota]] is admitted as the 32nd [[U.S. State]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[ironclad]] {{Ship|CSS|Virginia}} is scuttled in the [[James River (Virginia)|James River]] northwest of [[Norfolk, Virginia]].
*[[1867]] &ndash; [[Luxembourg]] gains its independence.
*[[1880]] &ndash; Seven people are killed in the [[Mussel Slough Tragedy]], a gun battle in [[California]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; An [[Wham Paymaster Robbery|attack upon a U.S. Army paymaster and escort]] results in the theft of over $28,000 and the award of two [[Medal of Honor|Medals of Honor]].
*[[1891]] &ndash; The [[Ōtsu incident]]: [[Tsarevich]] Nicholas Alexandrovich of [[Imperial Russia]] (later [[Nicholas II]]) suffers a critical head injury during a sword attack by Japanese policeman Tsuda Sanzō. He is rescued by [[Prince George of Greece and Denmark]].
*[[1894]] &ndash; [[Pullman Strike]]: Four thousand [[Pullman Palace Car Company]] workers go on a [[Wildcat strike action|wildcat strike]] in [[Illinois]].
*[[1907]] &ndash; Thirty-two [[Shriners]] are killed when their chartered train derails at a switch near Surf Depot in [[Lompoc, California]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; An act of the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] establishes [[Glacier National Park (U.S.)|Glacier National Park]] in [[Montana]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; The [[Mountainous Republic of the Northern Caucasus]] is officially established.
*[[1927]] &ndash; The [[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]] is founded.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[William Faulkner]]'s collections of [[Short story|short stories]], ''[[Go Down, Moses]]'', is published.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: American troops [[Battle of Attu|invade]] [[Attu Island]] in the [[Aleutian Islands]] in an attempt to expel occupying Japanese forces.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] begin a major offensive against the [[Axis Powers]] on the [[Gustav Line]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: Off the coast of [[Okinawa]], the [[aircraft carrier]] {{USS|Bunker Hill|CV-17|6}} is hit by two [[kamikaze]]s, killing 346 of its crew. Although badly damaged, the ship is able to return to the U.S. under its own power.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[UMNO]] is created.
*[[1949]] &ndash; Siam officially changes its name to [[Thailand]] for the second time. The name had been in use since [[1939]] but was reverted in [[1945]].
*  1949   &ndash; [[Israel]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; The [[1953 Waco tornado outbreak]]: an [[Fujita scale|F5]] tornado hits downtown [[Waco, Texas]], killing 114.
*[[1960]] &ndash;  In [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]], four [[Israel]]i [[Mossad]] agents capture fugitive [[Nazism|Nazi]] [[Adolf Eichmann]] who is living under the alias of Ricardo Klement.
*[[1963]] &ndash; Racist bombings in [[Birmingham, Alabama|Birmingham]], [[Alabama]] disrupt [[nonviolence]] in the [[Birmingham campaign]] and precipitate a [[Birmingham crisis|crisis]] involving federal troops.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Andreas Papandreou]], Greek [[economics|economist]] and socialist politician, is imprisoned in [[Athens]] by the [[Greek military junta of 1967–1974|Greek military junta]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; The [[Toronto Transit Commission]] opens the largest expansion of its [[Bloor–Danforth line]], going to [[Scarborough, Ontario|Scarborough]] in the East, and [[Etobicoke]] in the West.
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Lubbock Tornado]], a [[Fujita scale|F5]] tornado, hits [[Lubbock, Texas]], killing 26 and causing $250&nbsp;million in damage.
*[[1973]] &ndash; Citing government [[misconduct]], [[Daniel Ellsberg]] has charges for his involvement in releasing the [[Pentagon Papers]] to ''[[The New York Times]]'' dismissed.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Bradford City stadium fire]]: Fifty-six spectators die and more than 200 are injured in a flash fire at [[Valley Parade]] [[association football|football]] ground during a match against Lincoln City in [[Bradford]], England.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Klaus Barbie]] goes on trial in [[Lyon]] for [[war crime]]s committed during World War II.
*  1987   &ndash; In [[Baltimore, Maryland]], the first [[heart–lung transplant]] takes place. The surgery is performed by Dr. [[Bruce Reitz]] of the [[Stanford University School of Medicine]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; More than 170 countries extend the [[Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty]] indefinitely and without conditions.
*[[1996]] &ndash; After the aircraft's departure from [[Miami, Florida]], a fire started by improperly handled [[chemical oxygen generator]]s in the cargo hold of [[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]]-bound [[ValuJet Flight 592]] causes the [[Douglas DC-9]] to crash in the [[Florida Everglades]] killing all 110 on board.
*  1996   &ndash; The [[1996 Mount Everest disaster]]: on a single day eight people die during summit attempts on [[Mount Everest]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Deep Blue (chess computer)|Deep Blue]], a [[chess]]-playing [[supercomputer]], defeats [[Garry Kasparov]] in the [[Deep Blue – Kasparov, 1997, Game 6|last game]] of the rematch, becoming the first [[chess computer|computer]] to beat a world-champion chess player in a classic match format.
*[[1998]] &ndash; India conducts [[Pokhran-II|three underground atomic tests]] in [[Pokhran]] to include a [[thermonuclear]] device.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Second Chechen War]]: [[Chechen people|Chechen]] separatists [[Galashki ambush|ambush]] Russian paramilitary forces in the Republic of [[Ingushetia]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[David Cameron]] becomes [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] following [[2010 United Kingdom government formation|talks]] between the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservatives]] and [[Liberal Democrats]] to form the UK's first [[coalition government]] since World War II after [[United Kingdom general election, 2010|elections]] produced a [[hung parliament]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least 46 people are killed in a [[2013 Reyhanlı bombings|bombing]] in [[Reyhanlı]], [[Turkey]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; 15 people are killed and 46 injured in [[Kinshasa]] in a [[2014 Stade Tata Raphaël disaster|stampede]] caused by [[tear gas]] being thrown into the stand by police officers attempting to defuse a hostile incident.
